title: Stop nerfing DoT mages; nerf deathfire touch (the actual problem)
body:
tl;dr: Deathfire Touch broke Brand Swain Malz and Anivia, so instead of nerfing them nerf DT properly. I'd suggest making DT apply only on the first instance of damage from a DoT. 

There are nerfs on PBE to DT, but the nerfs to the champions DT made problematic have not been reverted.
1) Riot introduces something that breaks certain champions
2) Riot fixes this thing that breaks certain champions
3) Riot proceeds to nerf the champions anyways
????????

Furthermore, the present set of nerfs to DT on the PBE do not address the issue. It is has been pushed away from being a viable choice for non-DoT mages, while not properly addressing the interaction with DoT spells.


Riot has pushed nerfs to Brand, Swain, Malzahar, and Anivia to the PBE lately. This is presumably in response to the large jumps in winrate these champions have received due to the recent mastery reworks, particularly the synergy between DoT spells and the Deathfire Touch mastery. 

Their is nothing inherently overbearing in the kit of any of these champions. All four exemplify what Riot has often referred to as the Talon effect; small, dedicated playerbases experiencing success on a champion because of their familiarity with the champion. Aside from Anivia (who came into the competitive scene for her strength at containing juggernauts), none see competitive play. They were all perfectly acceptable champions until the mastery rework pushed them into the OP range.

Instead of nerfing these five champions and alienating their very small playerbases, why not just fix the root of the problem: the interaction between DoT spells and Deathfire. It is very tangibly this interaction that has given these champions such a spike in power and popularity.

 No Brand/Swain/Malz/Anivia players were asking for buffs and now these champions are being nerfed because Riot decided to meddle with the mastery system. Instead of making sweeping changes (removing a huge chunk of Swain's range, slashing Malzahar's tank melting ability (he's one of the only tank-shredding APs left! With the prevalence of juggernauts, midlane needs to keep this answer!), etc) to all these champions... simply fix the broken part of the system. Deathfire Touch.

I would suggest applying Deathfire Touch only on the first application of damage from a spell to balance the problem. This would turn the interaction between Malz E + DT into the same one as Vlad Q + DT, thus fixing the problem.

Thank you for your consideration.

Welcome to Riot Game Balance Philosophy 101!

1) Nerf the champ

2) Nerf the Item/skill/etc that made the champ op.

3) Never revert the nerf to the champ because reasons aka to admit we're wrong would be to undo the very fabric of creation itself.

DFT sets the base line for DoT mages. (and probably mages in general) They could probably nerf it if mages were, in general, way to strong. But even with 4 champs named, that's not really enough to say that mages (or even DoT mages) are in general too strong. 

Also, if they later found out that these fringe cases are still good, using a different mastery, then Nerfing DFT would not change anything, all while putting a lot more champs in a weaker spot.

Riot isn't going to nerf DFT in a way that makes it generally bad. (but they did nerf it's synergy with DoT) mostly because mages have few options outside of DFT. (I really don't want to put 18 in the cunning tree just to get Thunderlord's)

Brand has a 57% winrate in plat+ ranked games. I would politely disagree and say that that's too strong.
This is a 3-4% jump from where he was pre-mastery rework; a quick look at the point immediately to the problem. DFT + brand passive = absurd damage.

I don't think the other champions are too strong per se, but Riot does. Nerfs to Malzahar's damage, nerfs to Brand's mana costs, Anivia's Chill mechanic, Swain's CC (it appears the range nerf has been removed from PBE) have all been pushed this cycle. These are champions that have gone untouched for ages, and now that they've become accidentally strong through a mastery rework, Riot is nerfing them. That part doesn't make sense to me. Instead of nerfing the tried and true parts of the champion, why not nerf the new feature that threw the system out of equilibrium?

Nerfing DFT's interaction with DoT spells doesn't harm anyone else off the top of my head. Maybe like Zyra. The only part of DFT I suggest nerfing is its interaction with DoT spells (apply on successful spell cast, not on damage tick), as this is the only part of DFT that is game-warping.

Someone unrelated, I'd suggest you give Thunderlord's a second look... in general, it's much stronger than DFT. Except in these niche cases. But that's for another thread.

The change to DTF is actually a buff to single target mages and doesn't affect DoT mages TOO heavily (I think it reduces their damage by like 8 per spell), but it is of course a nerf. This makes sense because the actual nerfs to Swain, Anivia, Brand, and Malz aren't HUGE nerf either, just nerfs to keep them in check. It's actually a significant nerf to DoT mages, assuming I'm understanding DFT properly. It's only a buff (of 2 damage) to single target casters if they go the full four seconds without hitting the target again.

Live: 6 + 50% BAD + 20% AP over 3 seconds. AoEs and DoTs only last 1.5s.
PBE: 8 + 50% BAD + 20% AP over 4 seconds. AoEs lasts 2s. DoTs last 1s.

For both of these, the damage is dealt in half-second increments. If we have enough AD/AP to make it 100 damage total, the damage looks like this:

Live: 100 damage over 6 ticks of damage = 16.66 damage per tick.
AoEs and DoTs do 50 damage over 3 ticks.

PBE: 102 damage over 8 ticks of damage = 12.75 damage per tick.
AoEs do 51 damage over 4 ticks.
DoTs do 25.5 damage over 2 ticks.

This is already looking bad, but what happens when you apply it to an actual ability?

Let's say {{champion:90}}  has enough damage to cause DFT to do 100 damage over its full duration on Live.
Malefic Visions applies a DoT to the enemy for 4 seconds, dealing 8 ticks of damage total.

Live: 8 ticks of DFT from the spell dealing damage plus 2 more ticks means 10 ticks of 16.66 damage = 166.6 bonus damage
PBE: 8 ticks of DFT from the spell dealing damage plus 1 more tick means 9 ticks of 12.75 damage = 114.75 bonus damage

That's a loss of 51.85 damage making a 31.1% nerf on DFT's effectiveness with Malz E.

(congratulations if you got through this entire ~~post~~ math assignment)

Reducing the duration of Anivia's chill is pretty significant, actually, since she absolutely needs it on her E. Her E already has a somewhat slow travel time, allowing some champions to dash away and avoid the "crit." Nerfing the chill duration on her ult makes her combo even less reliable against mobile champions. And is anyone suggesting that her problem was "she can hit people 2 seconds after they leave her ult?" I thought the main concern was that she can drop R+E for a guaranteed crit. This nerf doesn't affect that.

The others I could take or leave-- though they aren't very consistent. They're hitting Malz's late-game tank shredding power (Null Zone is leveled up last, usually), but hitting Swain's early-game power (even though he's a late-game monster) and hitting Brand's mana pool.
